raw_response:
N'azha, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish, appears as a **rich, golden-yellow, fluffy herb omelet** with a firm yet tender texture. The vegan version made with chickpea flour has a **golden, slightly crispy exterior**, giving it a visually appealing, solid consistency — neither soupy nor stew-like. The interior is soft but holds together well, similar to a thick, fluffy pancake or fritter.

It is commonly served **either sliced or whole in sandwiches**, especially as a light appetizer or snack. Whe
